Visualizing Linear Regression
Using Ordinary Least Squares

Linear Regression is a statistical method to calculate relationships between inputs and outputs.
Linear Regression can only be applied to linear datasets. The aim is to find line that best fits the data.

The goal is prediction, forecasting, or error reduction, linear regression can be used to fit a predictive model to an observed data set of values of the response and explanatory variables.
Ordinary Least Squares is one of the easiest ways for linear regression.
In the Visualization, you can click to add data points on the canvas and see the model draw the line of best fit for the data points.
